intro: Echium saetabense, commonly known as the spiked fleur-de-lis, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces elongated, spiny seed capsules. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Echium saetabense is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
